in_ports.name: file
in_ports.caption: folder
in_ports.hint: [Optional] String path to the subfolder (or file). If specified, it is used instead of "Subfolder" parameter (with all replacements performed in that parameter).

out_ports.name: absolute_path
out_ports.caption: absolute path
out_ports.hint: Actual full absolute path to the file/folder.

controls.caption: When to remove?
controls.name: stage
controls.description: If set to "On reset", this function removes folder while reset. It means: when executing in a loop this function is performed only once, before 1st execution.

controls.caption: Do action
controls.name: doAction
controls.description:
If cleared, this function does nothing. You may use this flag if you need to remove folder not always, but, for example, only in the first or last iteration of some loop.
Note: the output port is filled always, regardless on this flag.
By default, this flag is CLEARED, because this function is very dangerous while incorrect usage.

controls.caption: Subfolder
controls.name: file
controls.description:
Subfolder to remove. This subfolder is removed RECURSIVELY with all its content!
Note: it can be also a file; in this case, this file will also be removed.
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test" or "samples/test". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_folder, %TEMP%/my_folder or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_folder.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

BE CAREFUL! WHILE INCORRECT USAGE, THIS FUNCTION CAN REMOVE A LOT OF IMPORTANT FILES FROM YOUR COMPUTER! Due to this reason, the flag "Skip action" is set by default.

controls.caption: Requires existing folder
controls.name: folderExistenceRequired
controls.description: If set, the path specified above must correspond to some existing subfolder. If cleared, the subfolder may not exist: in this function will do nothing.
